sample_detection.detect.audio module

class sample_detection.detect.audio.Audio(path: Optional[str] = None, audio: Optional[ndarray] = None, sample_rate: Optional[int] = 16000, start_time: Optional[str] = 0, clip_length: Optional[int] = None)

Bases: object

get_extract(start_time: int, extract_length: int) → Audio

Get an extract of the current audio clip.

Parameters

  • start_time (int) – Start time (in seconds) of the extract you want to get

  • extract_length (int) – Length (in seconds) of the extract you want to get

Returns

Extract of the current audio clip

sample_detection.detect.embedding_generators module

class sample_detection.detect.embedding_generators.EmbeddingGenerator(sample_duration, sample_rate)

Bases: ABC

abstract generate_embedding(audio_array: ndarray) → ndarray

Generate an embedding from an audio clip (represented as a 1D ndarray).

Parameters

audio_array (np.ndarray) – 1D np.ndarray representation of an audio clip

Returns

Embedding

generate_embeddings_from_directory(sample_info: DataFrame, audio_dir: str) → Tuple[DataFrame, Dict[str, Dict[int, ndarray]]]

Generate an embedding from an audio clip (represented as a 1D ndarray).

Parameters

  • sample_info (pd.DataFrame) – Sample info (as scraped from scraper), with sample times as lists

  • audio_dir (str) – Directory containing the audio files scraped by the scraper.

Returns

Dataframe of samples for which embeddings were succesfully generated, and a nested dictionary of

embeddings, with filenames and sample start times as keys, and embeddings as values.

sample_detection.detect.sample_detector module

class sample_detection.detect.sample_detector.SampleDetector(sample_duration: int, sample_rate: Optional[int] = None, embedding_generator: Optional[EmbeddingGenerator] = None, learning_rate: str = 'constant', learning_rate_init: float = 0.001, hidden_layer_sizes: Optional[Tuple[int, int]] = (256, 64), activation: Optional[str] = 'relu', max_iter: Optional[int] = 10000000, random_state: Optional[int] = 42)

Bases: object

find_samples(audio_1: Audio, audio_2: Audio, threshold: float, hop_length: int = 3) → List[Dict[str, float]]

Given two songs, find instances where one song contains a sample of the other.

Parameters

  • audio_1 (Audio) – Song 1

  • audio_1 – Song 2

  • threshold – Threshold above which to return samples.

Returns

List of dictionaries. Each dictionary contains the start time of the sample

in each song, the length of the sample, and the confidence score generated by the model for the sample.

fit(sample_info: DataFrame, audio_dir: str, min_negatives: int) → None

Fit the sample detection model.

Parameters

  • sample_info (pd.DataFrame) – Sample info (as scraped from scraper), with sample times as lists

  • audio_dir (str) – Directory containing the audio files scraped by the scraper.

  • min_negatives (pd.DataFrame) – Number of negative samples to generate per positive sample

predict(audio_1: Optional[Audio] = None, audio_2: Optional[Audio] = None, embedding_1: Optional[ndarray] = None, embedding_2: Optional[ndarray] = None)

Predict whether an audioclip contains a sample of another. All inputs are assumed to be audioclips ( or embeddings of audioclips) of length sample_duration (specified in constructor, and can be found under the sample_duration attribute).

Returns

Score indicating likelihood that one audioclip contains a sample of another

sample_detection.detect.sample_loader module

class sample_detection.detect.sample_loader.SampleLoader(sample_duration: int, sample_rate: int)

Bases: object

load_sample(audio_dir: str, sample: Series) → Tuple[bool, Dict[str, Union[None, Dict[int, ndarray]]]]

Load audio for both songs in a sample.

Parameters

  • sample (pd.Series) – Row from sample info dataframe (as scraped by scraper), with sample times as lists

  • audio_dir (str) – Directory containing the audio files scraped by the scraper.

Returns

Whether the sample was loaded successfully, and a nested dictionary of

embeddings, with filenames and sample start times as keys, and audio arrays as values.
